io.foxtrot.android.sdk

Class FoxtrotSDK

  • Object
    • io.foxtrot.android.sdk.FoxtrotSDK

  • public final class FoxtrotSDK
extends Object
    This is the entry point for the FoxtrotSDK. 

    
 FoxtrotSDK.setup(context, "THE-API-KEY");
 FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().registerLoginCallback(loginCallback);
 FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().login(driver);

    See Also:
    LoginCallback, RouteStateListener, ErrorStateListener

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public static void setup(android.content.Context context,
                         String dcApiKey)
        Setup the FoxtrotSDK with the application context and dcApiKey. dcApiKey is only required if you want to directly log in new drivers with login(Driver). If you need to change API keys, you can call setup() again with a new API key and it will be used for subsequent calls. If you plan to authenticate drivers with driver login tokens, you can pass null for the dcApiKey and use the loginDriverWithToken(Driver, String) method with driver login tokens instead.
        Parameters:
        context - the application context
        dcApiKey - the DC API key

      • setup

        public static void setup(android.content.Context context)
        Setup the FoxtrotSDK with the application context. This method should only be used if you intend to login via FoxtrotSDK##loginDriverWithToken(). This is the same as calling FoxtrotSDK.setup(context, null) {

      • isSetup

        public static boolean isSetup()
        Returns:
        true if and only if setup(Context, String) has been successfully called.

      • getInstance

        public static FoxtrotSDK getInstance()
        Access the FoxtrotSDK after it has been setup.
        See Also:
        setup(Context, String)

      • isLoggedIn

        public Boolean isLoggedIn(Driver driver)
        Check if the Driver has already logged in.
        Parameters:
        driver - - the driver to check
        Returns:
        true if the driver has already logged in

      • login

        public void login(Driver driver)
        Log in the driver to Foxtrot. This method should be called after registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback) Note that setup(Context, String) must have been called with a valid DC API key in order for this method to work. Otherwise, use loginDriverWithToken(Driver, String)
        Parameters:
        driver - the driver to be logged in.
        See Also:
        registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)

      • loginDriverWithToken

        public void loginDriverWithToken(Driver driver,
                                 String driverLoginToken)
        Log in the driver to Foxtrot using the driver's login token. A driver's login token can be obtained via the web APIs. Note that the login token must belong to the supplied Driver id. Details on the web apis can be found at https://api-docs.foxtrotsystems.com This method should be called after registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)
        Parameters:
        driverLoginToken - the login token belonging to the driver to be logged in
        See Also:
        registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)

      • resumeSession

        public void resumeSession(Driver driver)
        Resume the previous session if the driver has already successfully logged in on this device. resumeSession() will NOT start a new session for a driver, therefore it won't log out this driver from other devices. This method should be called after registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback).
        Parameters:
        driver - the driver who's session will be resumed.
        See Also:
        registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Log out the current driver.

      • registerLoginCallback

        public void registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback loginCallback)
        Register the LoginCallback. This method should be called before login(Driver)
        Parameters:
        loginCallback - the login callback

      • unregisterLoginCallback

        public void unregisterLoginCallback(LoginCallback loginCallback)
        Unregister the LoginCallback.
        Parameters:
        loginCallback - the login callback

      • getImportedRouteNames

        public Map<String,String> getImportedRouteNames()
        Return the mapping from route id to route name for all routes assigned to this driver
        Returns:
        the map

      • addRoute

        public String addRoute(Route route)
        Import a route to Foxtrot. This method should be called after registerRouteStateListener(RouteStateListener). The optimized route will be returned through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        route - the route
        Returns:
        the added route's ID. This is the same ID that will be available on the OptimizedRoute.getId() from RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet)
        See Also:
        registerRouteStateListener(RouteStateListener)

      • finishRoute

        public RouteSnapshot finishRoute(String routeId)
        Finish a route. If there are more routes to be completed, the new route will be returned through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback. If there are no more routes, then RouteStateListener.onAllRoutesFinished() will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        routeId - the route id
        Returns:
        a RouteSnapshot representing all the actions you've taken so far on the finished route.

      • registerRouteSnapshotSyncListener

        public void registerRouteSnapshotSyncListener(RouteSnapshotSyncListener listener)
        Register a RouteSnapshotSyncListener. The RouteSnapshotSyncListeners are used to determine when actions and data are all flushed to the server. This method should be use reciprocally with unregisterRouteSnapshotSyncListener(io.foxtrot.android.sdk.route.snapshot.RouteSnapshotSyncListener) to prevent memory leaks.
        Parameters:
        listener - The RouteSnapshotSyncListener to register.

      • unregisterRouteSnapshotSyncListener

        public void unregisterRouteSnapshotSyncListener(RouteSnapshotSyncListener listener)
        Unregister a RouteSnapshotSyncListener. Please ensure this is called for every listener registered with registerRouteSnapshotSyncListener(RouteSnapshotSyncListener) to prevent memory leaks.
        Parameters:
        listener - The RouteSnapshotSyncListener to unregister.

      • getPendingRouteSnapshots

        public Set<RouteSnapshot> getPendingRouteSnapshots()
        A blocking call to get the list of RouteSnapshots waiting to be uploaded. Generally, this should only be used after the app dies or when there is no other way to track which routes were recently finished. Otherwise, just register a RouteSnapshotSyncListener before finishing a route and remove it once the callback onUploadComplete() has been called. Please note that this is a blocking call and has so it should be used sparingly and should be called from a non-UI thread. A custom timeout can be implemented with a CountDownLatch or similar.

      • deleteRoute

        public void deleteRoute(String routeId)
        Delete a route. Delete should be used with care as routes will not have associated analytics or metadata. This method should only be used when a route is incorrect or otherwise will be replaced. This cannot be undone. If there are more routes to be completed, the new route will be returned through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback. If there are no more routes, then RouteStateListener.onAllRoutesFinished() will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        routeId - the route id

      • addDeliveryAttempt

        public void addDeliveryAttempt(String waypointId,
                               DeliveryAttempt attempt)
        Make a DeliveryAttempt on an OptimizedWaypoint. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        attempt - the attempt

      • addDeliveryAttemptForDelivery

        @Deprecated
public void addDeliveryAttemptForDelivery(String deliveryId,
                                                      DeliveryAttempt attempt)
        Deprecated. 
        Make a DeliveryAttempt on an OptimizedDelivery. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        deliveryId - the delivery id
        attempt - the attempt Deprecated: Please use addDeliveryAttemptForDeliveries(Map attemptMap) instead.

      • addDeliveryAttemptsForDeliveries

        public void addDeliveryAttemptsForDeliveries(Map<String,DeliveryAttempt> attemptMap)
        A batch version of addDeliveryAttemptForDelivery
        Parameters:
        attemptMap - a Map from deliveryIds to DeliveryAttempts

      • authorizeDeliveryReattempt

        public void authorizeDeliveryReattempt(String waypointId,
                                       DeliveryReattempt reattempt)
        Authorize a DeliveryStatus.AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT to a OptimizedWaypoint. A AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT can only be authorized if there has been a DeliveryStatus.FAILED attempt to deliver to that OptimizedWaypoint. Once the status has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        reattempt - the reattempt

      • authorizeDeliveryReattemptForDelivery

        @Deprecated
public void authorizeDeliveryReattemptForDelivery(String deliveryId,
                                                              DeliveryReattempt reattempt)
        Deprecated. 
        Authorize a DeliveryStatus.AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT to a OptimizedDelivery. A AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT can only be authorized if there has been a DeliveryStatus.FAILED for that OptimizedDelivery.
        Parameters:
        deliveryId - the delivery id
        reattempt - the reattempt Deprecated: please use authorizeDeliveryReattemptForDeliveries(Map reattemptMap)) instead.

      • authorizeDeliveryReattemptsForDeliveries

        public void authorizeDeliveryReattemptsForDeliveries(Map<String,DeliveryReattempt> reattemptMap)
        A batch version of authorizeDeliveryReattemptForDelivery.
        Parameters:
        reattemptMap - A map of deliveryIds to DeliveryReattempt

      • markDeliveryToVisitLater

        public void markDeliveryToVisitLater(String waypointId,
                                     DeliveryVisitLater visitLater)
        Mark this OptimizedWaypoint to be visited later. Once the status has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        visitLater - the visitLater

      • markDeliveryToVisitLaterForDelivery

        @Deprecated
public void markDeliveryToVisitLaterForDelivery(String deliveryId,
                                                            DeliveryVisitLater visitLater)
        Deprecated. 
        Mark this OptimizedDelivery to be visited later. Once the status has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        deliveryId - the delivery id
        visitLater - the visitLater Deprecated: Please use markDeliveriesToVisitLaterForDeliveries(Map visitLaterMap)

      • markDeliveriesToVisitLaterForDeliveries

        public void markDeliveriesToVisitLaterForDeliveries(Map<String,DeliveryVisitLater> visitLaterMap)
        A batch version of markDeliveryToVisitLaterForDelivery
        Parameters:
        visitLaterMap - The map of deliveryIDs to DeliveryVisitLaters

      • undoDeliveryAttempt

        public void undoDeliveryAttempt(String waypointId)
        Undo the previous DeliveryAttempt that was made to an OptimizedWaypoint. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been undone, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id

      • undoDeliveryAttemptForDelivery

        @Deprecated
public void undoDeliveryAttemptForDelivery(String deliveryId)
        Deprecated. 
        Undo the previous DeliveryAttempt that was made to an OptimizedDelivery. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been undone, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        deliveryId - the delivery id Deprecated: Please use undoDeliveryAttemptForDeliveries(Set deliveryIds)

      • undoDeliveryAttemptForDeliveries

        public void undoDeliveryAttemptForDeliveries(Set<String> deliveryIds)
        A batch version of undoDeliveryAttemptForDelivery
        Parameters:
        deliveryIds - The set of deliveryIDs to undo
